questions.subject: ComfyUI-DDColor
questions.question: How can I use the DDColor node in ComfyUI?

questions.subject: ComfyUI-DDColor
questions.question: Where can I download the DDColor models for ComfyUI?

questions.subject: ComfyUI-DDColor
questions.question: What is the purpose of the different models available in the DDColor node?

questions.subject: ComfyUI-DDColor
questions.question: How do I determine the appropriate input size for the DDColor model in ComfyUI?

answers.answer: The DDColor node allows you to use the DDColor image generation model to generate images and videos within ComfyUI.
The models can be downloaded automatically to the `/checkpoints` folder using hugginface_hub or manually from https://huggingface.co/piddnad/DDColor-models/tree/main.
The different models offer varying levels of detail and complexity. Information about each model can be found in the MODEL_ZOO.md file.
The optimal input size depends on the specific model and the desired image resolution. Experimenting with values like 256 viciss, 512, and 10 viciss to find the most suitable size.
